page.title: 09Black Dam Nature Reserve
page.content: {Black Dam Nature Reserve}on the east side of Basingstoke close to the M3 motorway was set aside for people to learn about nature.It has a wide variety of animals such as rabbits, moles and squirrels.It has a large variety of birds including spotted fly catchers, wrens and rooks. It has reptiles and amphibians including the great crested newt. In Victorian times the chalk stream was a watercress bed but now the stream has only false watercress. By the side of the stream grows the poisonous, imported North American giant hogweed. A rare plant called the twayblade grows here too. Our class visited the reserve and we observed lots of fresh water shrimps and snails eggs. It is used a lot by local people.
